name: market for buttermilk, from cow milk | buttermilk, from cow milk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10906/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'buttermilk, from cow milk', in the Global geography. This is a constrained market for consequential system model, for attributional system models, this is a regular market. In the case of consequential system model, details about the marginal consumer can be found in the comment of the conditional exchange (by-product).;No transport or losses are considered in the modelling of this market, as producers and consumers are not physically separated.;The product 'buttermilk, from cow milk' is a by-product of butter production. Per 1 kg of butter, 1.01 kg of buttermilk is produced.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'buttermilk, from cow milk',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  buttermilk, from cow milk', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
